subject: Relationships
title: Empathy vs. Sympathy in Relationships
description: A 60-second lesson on Empathy vs. Sympathy in Relationships.

hook.text: 'At least you still have...' is not empathy. It's a trapdoor that drops your partner into loneliness.

buildup.text: Sympathy says 'I feel sorry for you.' Empathy says 'I feel with you.' The difference changes everything.

discovery.text: Bren√© Brown's research shows empathy requires vulnerability. You must connect to your own pain to feel another's.

twist.text: Empathy can be exhausting. Therapists call it 'compassion fatigue.' Feeling everything isn't sustainable.

climax.text: Empathy isn't fixing. It's sitting in the dark with someone and saying, 'I'm here.' That's often enough.

punchline.text: Empathy isn't fixing the problem. It's sharing the weight.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between empathy and sympathy?
options: Empathy feels with someone; sympathy feels sorry for them
